general.title: Psychology research
general.subtitle: #Frontend #JS #EaselJs #Bootstrap #institution #eHealth #WebTreatment #Psychology
general.description: A web app for anxiety and depression treatment in adolescents

description: AMTE is a functional web app that attempts to study the effectiveness of diagnostic and treatment in anxiety and depression disorders in adolescents through the use of new technologies. The app, innovative in the sector, was developed for the Department of Psychology at UNED (National University of Online Education) under the supervision of Dr. Bonifacio Sandin, professor of Personality, Evaluation and Psychological Treatment.
credits: Manuel Ottaviano: Co-author and eHealth researcher

data.title: 3 APPS AND AN INFORMATIVE WEBSITE
data.description: The system allows for interaction among adolescents, therapists and parents through specific apps designed for each one. The different applications are accessed from a base website that also provides information for the general public

data.title: Simple UI and user flow
data.description: One of the biggest challenges was turning long, complex documents into attractive, easy-to-use tools

data.title: THE ADOLESCENT APP
data.description: Designed to learn and put into practice psychological concepts that help control situations of anxiety and depression

data.title: GUIDED EXPERIENCE
data.description: The application consists of several configurable modules with information, videos, tasks, games, and a chat to communicate with therapists. A customizable avatar guides the adolescent through the whole user flow

data.title: THE THERAPIST APP
data.description: Creation, configuration and personalized monitoring of each adolescent profile

data.title: GLOBAL VIEW
data.description: Therapists can personalize the modules for each adolescent, track progress and communicate with adolescents and their parents using the avatars and the chat

data.title: THE PARENT APP
data.description: Private access to monitor their child’s progress

data.title: PARENT INTERACTION
data.description: Parents have the option to offer support for their child using information and graphical data about the progress being made, along with a chat to communicate directly with therapists

data.title: BRAND IDENTITY
data.description: The image of the app had to encompass two very distinct target user groups: adolescents, and adult therapists and parents. Adolescents find a simple, clear interface and user flow, while the adults see a modern, serious image that instills trust

general.title: HAWK-EYE
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #InteractiveBooth #DesktopApp #SocketsCommunication #Game
general.description: Interactive installation with two desktop apps synchronized via sockets

description: This interactive installation was designed for Spain’s Rafa Nadal Museum. It includes two desktop apps that communicate with each other using sockets within the WiFi network they share.

Application “A” shows videos of game-point moments, and users have to use application “B” to respond whether the ball landed in or out of bounds. There are several rounds of play, the points are earned by answering correctly in the shortest amount of time.

data.title: match point video
data.description: Application “A” displays the first video as soon as all users are ready

data.title: User interaction
data.description: When the video ends, users have a limited amount of time to answer whether the ball landed in or out of bounds

data.title: hawk-eye 3d video
data.description: Once all users have answered or time runs out, Hawk-Eye technology is used to show a 3D recreation of the point

data.title: Scoring
data.description: The application shows the correct answer and the points earned by each user. After five rounds, the winner is announced

general.title: Westworld
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #SPA #JS #Angular5 #php #mailchimpApi
general.description: Web app gamificada para el registro de usuarios asistentes a un evento de cine inmersivo

description: The attendees to the immersive cinema event have to wear costumes. After responding to a series of questions, the app gives the user their unique character – including given name, surname, nickname, profession and background – and describes the outfit and personality they should use at the event.
Users access the app by entering a unique code on their event ticket. When they finish the questions, their attendance is officially registered.

data.title: Stepped form
data.description: If a user accesses the web after completing registration, they see the information about their character. If they have not yet completed registration, they are taken to the flow of questions to create a new character

data.title: CUSTOMIZED CHARACTER
data.description: Users can go back and see the details of their personalized character any time by entering the code on their event ticket

general.title: Reflexes
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #InteractiveInstalation #DesktopApp #Arduino #SportTraining
general.description: Instalación interactiva con Arduino para el entrenamiento deportivo

description: Interactive sports training game including a desktop app and two Arduino games.

The Arduino games light up buttons that the user has to press as quickly as possible to turn them off before time runs out. The desktop app communicates with Arduino to send game configuration, react to events and manage competing users’ scoring and records.

data.title: Desktop app
data.description: Configurable for children, adults, individual play or competition mode, the app manages scoring and records among competing users

data.title: The booth
data.description: Set up within the Rafa Nadal Museum in Spain, for public use and private training sessions

general.title: Camel Colors
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #AugmentedReality #iOS #Hybrid #Tablets #Event #php
general.description: Augmented reality iOS app for publicity action

description: Publicity action within Madrid’s Gay Pride Parade, with several iPads set up at different points along the path. The app allows users to put on make up and costumes related to the celebration, take a picture of themselves, and send it to an email in exchange for providing basic information that is stored in a database for future publicity actions.

data.title: FUNCTION
data.description: Users can choose from and play with a variety of make-up options, take a picture of the results, and send it to an email address of their choice

general.title: Game TNT
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #SPA #JS #AngularJS #EaselJs #php
general.description: HTML5 game for user registration to attend an immersive TV event

description: Attendees at the immersive TV event confirm their attendance using the HTML5 game, and attend the event dressed up as the TV character randomly assigned to them.

In the game, users have to find the character in an interactive illustration full of other characters. Once they find their character, the user’s information and character are saved in the event database.

Nationwide publicity action in which users can participate in a raffle by providing their basic information for future publicity use. To sign up for the raffle, they have to solve a puzzle by finding the three Winston eagles hidden in an image.

data.title: THE EAGLES
data.description: The eagles are found by placing the magnifying glass over them

data.title: THE SCENES
data.description: There are three different scenes, loaded randomly by the app

data.title: FORM WITH DIGITAL SIGNATURE
data.description: The users’ information and digital signature are stored in a database in the device, and later uploaded to a server

data.title: ADMIN PANEL
data.description: Administrators can handle configuration and back up data from the admin panel

general.title: Frutas & Verduras
general.subtitle: #Fullstack #FlashAwards #VirtualVisit #Illustration #OldSchooll
general.description: WEB APP WITH VIRTUAL TOUR OF A HOSTEL

description: The app allows users to explore the various areas of a hostel in Mexico. The virtual tour give a real vision of the hostel, while adding an artistic touch to the design.
The project was developed in 2010 using Flash, and won the Flash Awards that year.

data.title: THE VIRTUAL TOUR
data.description: The user can explore the different buildings throughout the hostel grounds

data.title: THE ILLUSTRATIONS
data.description: A collage of real photographs of the hostel, mixed with illustrations and textures to create artistic effect
